Posts.Content: Hi Anne, yes i used to have some very strange/disturbing/weird dreams when i had Fec thankfully they stopped after my second round of Fec i think mine were caused or certainly not helped by my anxiety re my chemo. I used to write down what i could remember in the morning and tell my sister about them, in the light of day they do not look quite so scarey but they definately stayed in the weired catagory :-)) Fingers crossed for you that they will stop quite soon. all the best irene
Posts.Title: Weird dreams

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a double mastectomy and have expanders fitted, i am going for my first fill up at the end of this month. I have just started chemo my second one due next week. If i now had to choose i would have left reconstruction until a later date. i have found that the chemo has been attacking all my surgery scars.Saying that, it is not unbareable. I suppose it depends on how much pain /discomfort you can tolorate. There is a woman i know personaly who had a double mastectomy 10 years ago, who did not plan on having reconstruction, but had it done last year and she is really happy with the results. Hope this helps irene
Posts.Title: Immediate or delayed recon?

Posts.Content: Morning Nain, Bloomin heck if it's not one thing it's another. I would be surprised if this has some thing to do with your lumph node removal, it sounds like and inner ear problem, they can throw you off balance and make you feel sick, unless you are taking some new tablets ? one of the girls has been off work for three weeks with labarinthitis (pretty sure that is not how it is spelt ) which is a problem with the inner ear, geta docs appointment if you can, and ring your breast care nurse if you have one she should be able to put you on the right track. take care Hugs Irene
Posts.Title: spining room and nausea

Posts.Content: Hi knotofpeace, I am pleased you have made the decision that suits you. We say it over and over again but it is true we are all different, leading different lives, at different ages. You have to choose what you think will be best for you.I just wish some one had told me that the chemo would attack my scars as i hear it is quite a commom side effect.I would not have made the decision i did. Thats what is great about this site you get such a range of opinions. let me know how you get on with your first chemo.How many are you having?, i am doing six, If i have to think about it as a whole i know i can not do six, but i can do one at a time , so i am doing the next one and we will see where we go from there. Irene
Posts.Title: Immediate or delayed recon?

Posts.Content: Hi Louise, I had a double mastectomy in oct, and to all intents and purpose my cancer is "gone" however i have opted to have 6 cycles of fec chemo to try ensure, if there were any  cells that had escaped or lurking, the chemo might get them. it is a lot to put yourself through  and the reason i am doing it is because my mum got breast cancer and lost one breast, she had no chemo but did take tamoxifen for five years, two years later she discovered she had bone , liver and lung cancer.  Most doctors will treat what they see, they will not go looking for other possible cancers.For me i opted for the chemo simply because of my mum and her experience. Give yourself a little time to think it through and get as much info as you possibly can before you make your decision.  all the best Irene
Posts.Title: Confused.......

Posts.Content: Hi to one and all,  i don't often post ,but i do read every thing that comes through. i can only describe my experience and how i deal with it, but if it can be of any help to any one, thats great. I was dianosed with tumors in both breasts in sept last year, needed a full mx on the right but chose to have a double mx as i felt i would get a better looking recon .I quickly learned to take someone with me to all meetings as i could not remember half of what was said.It was here that i met my breast consultant and my breast cancer nurse.It was from here that i had to make choices,what type of reconstruction would i like, i opted for chest expanders to be fitted at the same time as i had my mx and once filled and the skin stretched they would be replaced by a gel implant.Or a back flap and implant. I was told that at the same time as my op they would remove two lymph nodes from under each arm so they could be tested.But they were sure there was nothing there so it would not be a problem. I stopped work at this time as my concentration was shot to peices and my brain just would not switch off, I had my op on the 11th oct and i stayed in hospital for two days and came home with two drains in, for me the drains were more uncomfortable than the op it's self. This is when my district nurse came into my life and for me one of the most important people.,She wanted to see what was going on under all those plasters and to ensure i had no necrosis. On my next appt i was introduced to my breast reconstruction surgeon and nurse, and had fluid taken off the left and the right hand side.fluid build up was very painful for me and it was bliss when removed, i was then told that they had found cancer in two of my lymph nodes so i was back into hospital for my second op in three weeks. They removed all lymph nodes from my left hand side again i was in hospial for two days and came home with a drain in.Some people stay in hospital longer it just depends on how you are coping and how well you feel. The chest expanders i found reaally very painful, there were some days and nights that they felt so tight i thought i would not be able to get a breath.If you can imagine a belt below and one above your breasts pulled really tight.thats pretty much how it felt. Next i met my oncolagy consultant  and my chemo nurse and  was told i would need fec chemo, 6 courses,but befor i could begin i would need a small op to put in a Groushon line as my veins were not very good. i had my first dose 3 weeks ago and found the first week quite hard although i feel fine now, due my second one on wed. It was about this time that i was begining to feel that i was not coping and getting very stressed.I finally realised that it was because i felt i had lost all control of my life. I had started with a plan and it was changed as new problems arose, i did not expect there to be the pain that there was , i was totaly unprepared for a lot of what i was going through. And this is the problem, treatment seems to vary from place to place, and of course people's lives vary . Now my chest expanders are settling down and much more comfortable and i am dealing with my chemo one treatment at a time. I have given myself the option of stopping if i feel i can not go on, If you are lucky you will be able to have a chat with people i have met here who have been such a help and inspiration, Antsi who has had such a bloody terrible time of it ,but who is here answering concerns in such a cheerfull funny maner that she can grab a smile from even the most miserable of us. And Helen who is on a mission to refurbish her whole  house and nothing is going to stop her also has the tme and the inclination to try and help. As for me i have decided that i can only do one day at a time and only deal with one problem at a time. But i do have choices ,that for me is very important. Today what was left of my hair was a problem, so i cut it off, then shaved my head.:-)) problem solved If i can be of any help to any one do get in touch and i will answer if i can Good thoughts and wishes to you all Irene
Posts.Title: whats it like????

Posts.Content: Whoop Whoop, great news, i am so very pleased for you, it won't be long before you can do most things on your list. nice to find another sax player , although i had just started to learn when cancer hit me and i have not picked it back up again yet, i think i will wait until i get my implants in. any way love and hugs irene
Posts.Title: Finished Rads now Tamoxifen!!!

Posts.Content: Hi, it has got to be worth calling your breast nurse in the morning, any swelling should be checked out i would have thought. i had my lymph nodes removed in Nov last year and under my arm can still be stiff and sore, i am going to see the physio to see if there is anything they can do or if there is an underlying problem. i am sure they will not mind you calling, fingers crossed that it not serious Hugs Irene
Posts.Title: Pains in arm where lymph nodes removed in January - starting to panic...

Posts.Content: Really!!!!!! well i have to say up beat is my normal setting so hopefully that might help. But i must inform my breast care nurses and oncolagist, as they are telling people quite the oppisite. Irene
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hi sascha rose, you are right we will have to agree to disagree. i also agree that we can not be happy and positive 100% of the time , please see earlier post "twisted expander" that is me, in pain, swearing, shouting and throwing cups at the wall. i feel i am very lucky in my personality, in that i am naturally optimistic, of course this did not stop me getting cancer. So i have no reason to think it will cure me. But what it does mean for me at least is that i can face each new challenge with hope in my heart, and i don't know any one who would deny me this hope. My mother used to say that "misery likes company" she died of breast cancer . i miss her very much and i grieve for her loss and i have also grieved for the loss of who i was. I cry when i need to , But i will not wallow in that loss as i really believe that life is for living and for getting as much enjoyment out of it as i can. i wish you well sascha rose Irene
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: A voice of sanity, thank goodness
Posts.Title: Mel B´s "campaign"

Posts.Content: Hi Annie, Thats really good news, i know, that after what felt like months of being "sick" to go back to work even for just a short time was great. I have to stop work for an op in Dec but i am making the most of being out and about. Please be careful though as after my chemo i seem to be catching everything, cough,colds but for me it is worth every sniffle :-)) hugs Irene
Posts.Title: Might be going back to work :)

Posts.Content: Hi all, I am hoping some one can give me some info re having a Groschong line put in. I had a double mastectomy in oct and lymph nodes removed in Dec. I was suppose to start 6 sessions of FEC chemo today but when i went for my checks on monday they said i needed a line in, which i now have an appointment for next Tues, then have the chemo on wed then a heart check up on the thursday. If anyone can tell me anything about this type of line i would be very grateful. irene
Posts.Title: GROSCHONG LINE

Posts.Content: Hi Annie, Thats really good news, i know, that after what felt like months of being "sick" to go back to work even for just a short time was great. I have to stop work for an op in Dec but i am making the most of being out and about. Please be careful though as after my chemo i seem to be catching everything, cough,colds but for me it is worth every sniffle :-)) hugs Irene
Posts.Title: Might be going back to work :)

Posts.Content: Hi Mellissa, Many thanks for the info ,can you tell me how long it took to put in . many thanks Irene
Posts.Title: GROSCHONG LINE

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy I had a double mastectomy and expanders fitted in nov with total lymph node removal on the left side in dec. re the pain from the expanders, from what i have read from others on the site and my own experience it can take anywhere from six weeks to  two months and upwards to completly settle down. it seems to be a totaly individual thing, i am still having some pain from mine mainly on the side that my nodes were removed from and as you can see i am approx 5 months on, mine is also agravated from my chemo which attacks all my scars. Yours i am sure will settle down a lot quicker, keep on taking the pain killers and keep up with any physio/exercises that you have been given, you are only two weeks post op and it is a big operation which will have affected all your chest muscles and you will have very deep brusing. be kind to yourself and give yourself time to heal. I found that a bean bag that you can heat in the microwave very helpful laid across my scars the heat soothed it a bit, i also slept propped up on my back in bed ,on a sloped bed rest which i borrowed from my district nurse, it was useful for the first month or so. It also helps to rub cream in every day when your scars are completly healed hopes this helps with some of your questions irene
Posts.Title: Double mastectomy immediate reconstruction with implants please h...

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy I think it was about six weeks before i was happy to drive, once again the side i had the lymph nodes removed from caused the problem, the left hand side has always been 3 weeks behind the right side as regards healing. I forgot to mention that some times the expanders creak a bit, well my left one sort of creaks like old leather, it's not all the time and it is not audible to any one outside, I have not experienced any rippling in my expanders, but i know mistymoley has a problem with it. Really just let your body tell you what you can and can not do, i tried to lift a bag of manure yesterday and i could not manage it(mind you it was a full bag) had to put up with a 5 minute rant from husband and a sore chest for the rest of the day. Enjoy the rest while you can, it does not last long, i know it feels like forever at the moment, but it will pass. take care Irene
Posts.Title: Double mastectomy immediate reconstruction with implants please h...

Posts.Content: Oh Kate, you hit the nail on the head when you say "New normal" every one around me has noticed that i am "not quite myself" this normally applies when i say "no " to some thing, No i am not working on my day off,but i will pitch in on my next shift, No i am not going grocery shopping today it's to nice lets go for a walk instead, no i won't lend you £50 you will never pay it back so i will just give you the money. I certainly don't think i am the same person i was before i started this. and i can not say that i am a better or worse person for having gone through it . But i am different, many of my views and attitudes have changed . And so i am me, the new NORMAL me, and they can like it or lump it :-)so thanks for that Kate hugs irene
Posts.Title: What now ?

Posts.Content: Morning Winston, i am so pleased that you are feeling a bit better today. Lovely idea re changing your profile pic, wish i was brave enough to put one up.Still look to much like uncle fester off the adams family ! Similarities not such a coincidence when you think how many ladies are here on the mac site, bet there are lots more who just read and never post! :-) Take care and hope you get a fab wig. Hugs Irene
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Winston, you appear to have had a similar cancer and treatment to mine, and at times it seems as if it is just one thing after the other and none of them very good. I did just what you did came here and vented, and it is really good to get it off your chest. but also like you i was getting a bit of hassel from occupational health at work. It seemed like it would never stop and then chemo on top! eventually it all became to much and i sought some outside help via my gp, i saw a counsellor for several sessions and he really helped me sort some things out in my mind. Hang on in there and you willl see some light at the end of the tunnel. Hugs Irene P.S i did quite enjoy having my wig fitted it allowed me to try out some really outrageous styles that i would never have been brave enough to do to my own hair
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Similarities not such a coincidence when you think how many ladies are here on the mac site, bet there are lots more who just read and never post! :-) Take care and hope you get a fab wig. Hugs Irene

Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Tinkersi was very interested in diynatural.com but i am unable to access the web site ? thanks Irene
Posts.Title: My Cancer is ER+ any top tips and advice on what I should avoid in...

Posts.Content: Many thanks for that info , i will have a look, i am using some thing a bit like rock salt at the moment, the name escapes me, my chemo brain and memory lives on :-)) I have found a web site that does many different brands of paraben free stuff, it's just so expensive ! still struggling a bit with money as only recently back to work. Any way thanks again. Irene
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Hi Tinkers with all the advice re paraben free stuff i should be able to clear everything out . I do try with my daughter who is at the age where she colours her hair and has nail varnish on constantly, but she is at uni and "having fun and enjoying her life " her forms for genetic testing have been laying around for nearly 10 months now and she has not made up her mind yet !! Well i will go and look at Gorgeously green , thamks for that Irene
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Hi caroline, to right it is confusing, i can only tell you what i use, which is " pure unrefined 100% shea butter", no perfumes , no additives, The tub i have at the moment is a bit grainy which is ok because it melts as you rub it between your hands. I am not sure if i can give the name out on the site? oh well it is Sheaby nature. It suits me very well and although it seems expensive it does go a long way. Hugs Irene
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Hi , Yes i have been struggling to find some thing that will keep me clean and smelling fresh throughout the day. the bare minerals i knew about, and myself and daughter are going to have a make over using them for my birthday which is coming up soon. But i did not know about the origins line, so thank you i will have a look at them. Some one had mentioned "Black soap " which i have not looked into yet. And has any one found a decent deoderant that is not full of chemicals. i know since my lymph node removal i only sweat from the other arm, but i still feel i need some thing.The shampoo i have been using is from the sammy range from super drug. many thanks for the info Hugs Irene
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Hi Londongurl, i have been using natural shea butter since my op on my scars, i got my first tub through amazon and my second off ebay, anyware that is the cheapest really :-) i just wanted to say that they mix shea butter with all sorts so, if you can, go with the natural shea butter, my first tub felt quite grainy and i rub it between my hands until it melts and goes smooth, the scond tub was whipped but it did not last very long. I really do like it but, it has a kind of a smell in the tub which does fade when it is applied. i think we are just so used to perfumed smells that a natural smell , smells odd ! i have learned a lot via this thread so many thanks to all who are contributeting (sorry my spelling is terrible, hugs Irene
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: many thanks kittycat, i shall have a look after i have picked the last of my broadbeans. Got to get out while the weather is good :-) i will let you know if i make anything.Please let me know if you and your son manage to concoct something, i love personal reccomendations. Any one else got any recomendation for do it your self books????? Hugs Irene
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Hi Kittycat, please can you give me the name of the book please, since my cancer i have gone back to work only part time, so i do have the time :-) and my daughter is at uniand She still uses all the bad things, but if i could make her some thing nice, with out all the nastys in it she might change her mind. Thanks Irene
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Hi all, I just wanted to stop by and say a big thank you to everyone who has helped me get through the last seven months. I had my last chemo last week and i am begining to feel like a human being once more. I have no idea who that human being is,  when i look in the mirror i don't recognise myself, no hair, no breasts,no eye brows or lashes and nearly 15 kilos overweight and i bear a strange resemblance to uncle fester from the adams faily. Still i am here and my daughter says i am a work in progress :-) I am so sorry to see so many newbies here, and yet strangely re assured that the worries and problems you are all having is exactly what we all went through when we started. We got through , and you will to.Never doubt that for a moment. I have had lots of support from the site and the people on it, and just wanted to say a big thank you to them all. I will be dropping in from time to time as i still have reconstruction to do and will have to take some sort of meds for five years, but i think i am ready for my life back. When i first started with my cancer treatment some one said to me " having treatment for cancer is like eating and elephant with a teaspoon. You can only do it one spoon at a time" and it is so very true. You feel like it is going on forever , and that you will never be done, but you will get there. love and hugs to you all Irene
Posts.Title: Getting there

Posts.Content: Hi Amandjh I had a double mx in nov last year and had expanders fitted, my scar healed quite well but i had fluid removed twice from the left side and once from the right. I found the expander very painfull,some days it felt like i could hardly draw a breath they were so tight, now 10 weeks on they are still uncomfortable but not all the time.and on the odd occassion i can forget they are there. Non of the fluid i had removed was underneath the expanders and perhaps this is the main problem? i am not sure how they would go about removing fluid from underneath the expander as the last thing you would need is a punctured expander. Sorry i can not be of more help to you, hopefully some one out there will know more, take care and i hope all goes well with your op irene
Posts.Title: Anyone had expander problems ?

Posts.Content: Hi Kirstie, Thanks fo r the positive reply, i have my fingers crossed that they will bounce back. I have phoned the oncology unit and i am going in tomorrow to have another blood test done, i am assuming they will make some sort of decision then. Also because i have never had my bloods done mid cycle i have no idea by how much they normally fluctuate. I can see they are dropping month by month and to be honest i was more worried about the posibility of having to have a blood transfusion because of my low red cell count, than this. So when doctor phoned last night it caught me unaware, and again i dont know how low is low? any way we will see what they say tomorrow take care Irene
Posts.Title: neutropenia

Posts.Content: Hi All had my fifth round of chemo 2 weeks ago, district nurse came to clean my line and take some bloods as my counts had been low last time. My doctor rang me last night to say i was neutropenic at 0.3. and i should be careful not to catch any type of infection. Question is will they cancel my next (last ) chemo and should i ring oncology to let them know. i will be gutted if i have to change my chemo dates, was planning a short break to celebrate. any advice would be welcome. irene
Posts.Title: neutropenia

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, sorry to hear you are having such a rough time of it, my treatment has been plain sailing compared to yours. I hear you re the constpation though, my regime normally went some thing like this day before chemo after evening meal have some prunes in juice. day of chemo along with lots of water sipped throughout the day, i exchange my cups of tea for warm/hot orange juice the dilute kind, if i have not been to the toilet on chemo day or the next morning  i start movicol which i got from the chemo unit and i will have up to six in one day spaced throughout the day, normally that will do the trick, veg does not work for me so i stck to fruit.  I think i will ring the oncology unit and see what they have to say, be a nightmare if i get sick over the bank holiday weekend. take care Irene
Posts.Title: neutropenia

Posts.Content: Hi debra, Many thanks for the info, i would not normally be very worried it's just that it's a blooming bank holiday weekend, and we had planned a short break, and i was so very near the end :-(((( Normally they take my bloods when i turn up for my chemo which will be wed next week. I f i am going to be disapointed i would like to get my crying out of the way befor i turn up. :-) Thanks Irene
Posts.Title: neutropenia

Posts.Content: Hi Kathleen No i have no antibiotics, congrats on getting through your chemo, onwards and upwards :-)) Whats worrying me is that it is a bank holiday weekend, also i can see the light at the end of the tunnel and had assumed that i would be in the clear after next Wed and now all that might go down the drain. I just feel so disapointed Thanks anyway Irene
Posts.Title: neutropenia

Posts.Content: Hi Tinkers, many thanks for the helpful reading list. I shall go and see if i can find them. hugs Irene
Posts.Title: recovery/staying healthy

Posts.Content: Hi all, Is any one looking at diet/alternative medicine as a way of staying healthy/cancer free after we get through this bloody awful time? I would love to hear from anyone who is, or any helpful books or articles i can read. I had a double mastectomy with temp implants in oct, lymph nodes removed in nov, groushon line put in Dec and i am now half way through fec chemo. I can see the light at the end of the tunnel, but as yet i am to tired to walk towards it very quickly :-) Irene
Posts.Title: recovery/staying healthy

Posts.Content: Hi Nain, I had three lymph nodes removed from each side when the did my double mastectomy,strangely enough the side with the large tumor had no cancer showing in the nodes , but the side with the small tumor showed cancer in two out of the three nodes. My Doctor reccomended full removal. I did have a full removal and i wish i could say it has been problem free, i am still seeing the physio for some problems re stiffness and discomfort. But it is a lot better and part of the problem is that i have expanders fitted and they are irritating the muscle that is under the armpit. I have read from others that they have had little or no problem with the lymph removal. The strangest thing is that i now do not sweat under that arm, so i have to remember to put deodorant on the good arm :-)) Hugs irene
Posts.Title: Remove or Not Remove Underarm Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Hi caroline, why on earth would you think you were letting the side down?? even the most positive of us have bad days where we cry and feel terribly sad, about who we were and what we have lost. So this is the place to do it, and you normally get replies from those of us who are feeling a little more upbeat and positive on the day, and those of us in the group who are having a day just like you , either don't reply because it may be to difficult. or some can find that they can muster up enough support to try and make you feel a little better and supported. I like you, hate to have to rely on people when i was so used to doing every thing my self. And my frustration levels were very high. Take heart it wil not be long before you are back in the swing of things, so try for the moment to go with the flow and be nice to yourself and give your body time to heal. And when you get really angry let it out, you can scream under a duvet and it does not frighten the neighbours :-) hugs Irene
Posts.Title: so fed up of it all
